A hanging sign can also display text, but it has more variable ways to be placed: on the side of and the underside of solid blocks, fences, walls, chains, and other hanging signs.
description.minecraft.crimson_hyphae: Wood or hyphae is a block that has the log's "bark" texture on all six sides.
description.minecraft.crimson_nylium: Nylium is a variant of netherrack that generates in the Nether.
description.minecraft.crimson_planks: Planks are common blocks used as building blocks and in crafting recipes.
description.minecraft.crimson_roots: Roots are a non-solid "plant" block that come in two variants, crimson roots and warped roots, which generate naturally on warped or crimson nylium and soul soil in their respective biomes.
description.minecraft.crimson_sign: A sign is a non-solid block that can display text. A sign can also be used to block or redirect the flow of water or lava while still allowing entities to pass.
description.minecraft.crimson_slab: Slabs are half-height versions of their respective blocks.
description.minecraft.crimson_stairs: Stairs are blocks that allow mobs and players to change elevation without jumping.
description.minecraft.crimson_stem: A log or stem is a naturally occurring block found in trees or huge fungi, primarily used as a building block, and to create planks, a versatile crafting ingredient.
description.minecraft.crossbow: A crossbow is a ranged weapon similar to a bow that uses arrows or fireworks as ammunition.
description.minecraft.crying_obsidian: Crying obsidian is a luminous variant of obsidian that can be used to craft a respawn anchor.
description.minecraft.cut_copper: The block of copper and cut copper are blocks that oxidize over time, gaining a verdigris appearance over four stages. They can be prevented from oxidising by being waxed with honeycombs. Non-cut, non-oxidised, non-waxed copper blocks are storage blocks equivalent to nine copper ingots.
description.minecraft.cut_copper_slab: Slabs are half-height versions of their respective blocks.
description.minecraft.cut_copper_stairs: The block of copper and cut copper are blocks that oxidize over time, gaining a verdigris appearance over four stages. They can be prevented from oxidising by being waxed with honeycombs. Non-cut, non-oxidised, non-waxed copper blocks are storage blocks equivalent to nine copper ingots.
description.minecraft.cut_red_sandstone: Sandstone is a solid block commonly found in deserts and beaches underneath sand.
description.minecraft.cut_red_sandstone_: Slabs are half-height versions of their respective blocks.
description.minecraft.cut_sandstone: Sandstone is a solid block commonly found in deserts and beaches underneath sand.
description.minecraft.cut_sandstone_slab: Slabs are half-height versions of their respective blocks.
description.minecraft.cyan_banner: Banners are tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes and banner patterns.
description.minecraft.cyan_bed: A bed is a block that allows a player to sleep and to reset their spawn point to within a few blocks of the bed in the Overworld. If the bed is obstructed or removed, the player spawns at the default world spawning location.
description.minecraft.cyan_candle: A candle is a block that comes in any of the sixteen dye colors, as well as an undyed variant.
description.minecraft.cyan_carpet: Carpets are thin variants of wool that can be dyed in any of the 16 colors.
description.minecraft.cyan_concrete: Concrete is a solid block available in the 16 regular dye colors
description.minecraft.cyan_concrete_powd: Concrete powder is a gravity-affected block that is converted to concrete when touching water or lava. It comes in the 16 regular dye colors.
description.minecraft.cyan_dye: Cyan dye is a secondary dye color.
description.minecraft.cyan_glazed_terrac: Glazed terracotta is a vibrant solid block that comes in the 16 regular dye colors, obtained by smelting colored terracotta.
description.minecraft.cyan_shulker_box: A shulker box is a block that can store and transport items.
description.minecraft.cyan_stained_glass: Glass is a decorative and fully transparent solid block that can be dyed into stained glass, or crafted into tinted glass.
A glass pane is a transparent block that can be used as a more efficient alternative to glass blocks.
description.minecraft.cyan_terracotta: Terracotta is a block that comes in the sixteen dye colors (except with a brownish tint), as well as an undyed variant.
description.minecraft.cyan_wool: Wool is a block obtained from sheep that can be dyed in any of the sixteen different colors. It can be used as a crafting material and to block vibrations.
description.minecraft.damaged_anvil: An anvil is a block that allows players to repair items, rename items, and combine enchantments.
description.minecraft.dandelion: Flowers are non-solid plants that occur in a variety of shapes and colors.
description.minecraft.dark_oak_boat: A boat is a drivable vehicle entity used primarily for fast transport of players and passenger mobs over bodies of water.
description.minecraft.dark_oak_button: A button is a non-solid block that can provide temporary redstone power.
description.minecraft.dark_oak_chest_boa: A boat with chest is a single chest occupying the passenger seat of a boat, and functions as such. As it can still be driven it can be used to transport items over bodies of water.
description.minecraft.dark_oak_door: A door is a block that can be used as a barrier that can be opened by hand or with redstone.
description.minecraft.dark_oak_fence: A fence is a barrier block that cannot normally be jumped over, similar to a wall. Unlike a wall, a player (but not mobs) can see through the openings in a fence.
description.minecraft.dark_oak_fence_gat: A fence gate is a block that shares the functions of both the door and the fence.

description.minecraft.diamond: A diamond is a rare mineral obtained from diamond ore or loot chests.
description.minecraft.diamond_axe: An axe is a tool mainly used to hasten the breaking of wood-based blocks, remove the surface layer of certain blocks, and as a melee weapon.
description.minecraft.diamond_block: A block of diamond is a precious mineral block equivalent to nine diamonds.
description.minecraft.diamond_boots: Boots are a type of armor that covers the feet of the player.
description.minecraft.diamond_chestplate: Chestplates are a type of armor that covers the upper body of the player.
description.minecraft.diamond_helmet: Helmets are a type of armor that covers the head of the player.
description.minecraft.diamond_hoe: A hoe is a tool used to till dirt, grass blocks, and dirt paths into farmland, convert coarse dirt into dirt, as well as to harvest certain plant-based blocks quickly.
description.minecraft.diamond_horse_armo: Horse armor is a special type of armor that can be given to a horse to wear.
description.minecraft.diamond_leggings: Leggings are a type of armor that covers the lower body of the player.
description.minecraft.diamond_ore: Diamond ore is a rare ore that generates deep underground, and is the only reliable source of diamonds.
description.minecraft.diamond_pickaxe: A pickaxe is one of the most commonly used tools in the game, being required to mine all ores, rock, rock-based blocks and metal-based blocks.
description.minecraft.diamond_shovel: Shovels are tools used to ease the process of collecting dirt, sand and other blocks with silk touch mining the complete block.
description.minecraft.diamond_sword: The sword is a melee weapon that is mainly used to deal damage to entities or for breaking certain blocks faster than by hand.
description.minecraft.diorite: Diorite is a block of igneous rock, found in large pockets in the ground.

description.minecraft.dirt: Dirt is a block found abundantly in most biomes under a layer of grass blocks at the top of the Overworld.
description.minecraft.dispenser: A dispenser is a low-capacity storage block that can fire projectiles, use certain items or tools or place certain blocks, fluids or entities when given a redstone signal.
description.minecraft.dolphin_spawn_egg: A spawn egg is an item used to spawn mobs directly.
description.minecraft.donkey_spawn_egg: A spawn egg is an item used to spawn mobs directly.
description.minecraft.dragon_breath: The dragon's breath is a brewing item that is used solely to make lingering potions.
description.minecraft.dragon_egg: The dragon egg is a decorative block or a "trophy item", and is the rarest item obtainable in the game, as it generates once (or twice in Bedrock Edition).
description.minecraft.dried_kelp: Dried kelp is a food item that can be quickly eaten by the player.
description.minecraft.dried_kelp_block: Dried kelp blocks are storage blocks equivalent to nine dried kelp that can also be used as fuel.
description.minecraft.dripstone_block: The dripstone block is a rock block that allows pointed dripstone to grow beneath it.
description.minecraft.dropper: A dropper is a low-capacity storage block that can eject its contents into the world or into other containers when given a redstone signal.
description.minecraft.drowned_spawn_egg: A spawn egg is an item used to spawn mobs directly.
description.minecraft.echo_shard: An echo shard is an item found in ancient cities which can be used to craft recovery compasses.
description.minecraft.egg: An egg is an item that can be used to craft food items, or thrown for a chance to spawn chicks on impact.
description.minecraft.elder_guardian_spa: A spawn egg is an item used to spawn mobs directly.
description.minecraft.elytra: Elytra ( /ˈɛl ɪ trə/ ᴇʟ-i-trə) are rare wings found in end ships that are a source of flight in Survival mode.
description.minecraft.emerald: Emeralds are rare minerals that are used primarily as the currency for trading with villagers and wandering traders.
description.minecraft.emerald_block: A block of emerald is a precious mineral block equivalent to nine emeralds.
description.minecraft.emerald_ore: Emerald ore is a rare mineral block that generates only in mountains, frozen peaks and windswept hills biomes.
description.minecraft.enchanted_book: An enchanted book is an item that lets players add enchantments to certain items using an anvil.
description.minecraft.enchanted_golden_a: An enchanted golden apple (in Java Edition) or enchanted apple (in Bedrock Edition), is a rare, uncraftable variant of the golden apple that grants much more powerful effects when consumed.

description.minecraft.end_portal_frame: An end portal frame is a block that resembles end stone with a decorative bluish-green top, with sides decorated in hollow rounded rectangles with the same color as the top.
description.minecraft.end_rod: An end rod is a decorative light source that emits white particles.
description.minecraft.end_stone: End stone is a block that appears in the End and, apart from generated structures, makes up all of the solid ground that exists in that dimension.

description.minecraft.netherite_ingot: Netherite ingots are items obtained from crafting netherite scraps and gold ingots together, as well as loot from bastion remnant loot chests.
description.minecraft.netherite_leggings: Leggings are a type of armor that covers the lower body of the player.
description.minecraft.netherite_pickaxe: A pickaxe is one of the most commonly used tools in the game, being required to mine all ores, rock, rock-based blocks and metal-based blocks.
description.minecraft.netherite_scrap: Netherite scrap is a material smelted from ancient debris, which is found in the Nether.
description.minecraft.netherite_shovel: Shovels are tools used to ease the process of collecting dirt, sand and other blocks with silk touch mining the complete block.
description.minecraft.netherite_sword: The sword is a melee weapon that is mainly used to deal damage to entities or for breaking certain blocks faster than by hand.
description.minecraft.netherrack: Netherrack is a frail stone block found abundantly in the Nether and in blobs below ruined portals.
description.minecraft.note_block: A note block is a block that emits sounds when attacked, used or powered with redstone.
description.minecraft.oak_boat: A boat is a drivable vehicle entity used primarily for fast transport of players and passenger mobs over bodies of water.
description.minecraft.oak_button: A button is a non-solid block that can provide temporary redstone power.
description.minecraft.oak_chest_boat: A boat with chest is a single chest occupying the passenger seat of a boat, and functions as such. As it can still be driven it can be used to transport items over bodies of water.
description.minecraft.oak_door: A door is a block that can be used as a barrier that can be opened by hand or with redstone.
description.minecraft.oak_fence: A fence is a barrier block that cannot normally be jumped over, similar to a wall. Unlike a wall, a player (but not mobs) can see through the openings in a fence.
description.minecraft.oak_fence_gate: A fence gate is a block that shares the functions of both the door and the fence.
description.minecraft.oak_hanging_sign:
A sign is a non-solid block that can display text. A sign can also be used to block or redirect the flow of water or lava while still allowing entities to pass.

A hanging sign can also display text, but it has more variable ways to be placed: on the side of and the underside of solid blocks, fences, walls, chains, and other hanging signs.
description.minecraft.oak_leaves: Leaves are natural blocks that generate as part of trees.
description.minecraft.oak_log: A log or stem is a naturally occurring block found in trees or huge fungi, primarily used as a building block, and to create planks, a versatile crafting ingredient.
description.minecraft.oak_planks: Planks are common blocks used as building blocks and in crafting recipes.
description.minecraft.oak_pressure_plate: A pressure plate is a non-solid block that can be used to detect players, mobs, items, etc.
description.minecraft.oak_sapling: A sapling is a non-solid block that can be grown into a tree.
description.minecraft.oak_sign: A sign is a non-solid block that can display text. A sign can also be used to block or redirect the flow of water or lava while still allowing entities to pass.
description.minecraft.oak_slab: Slabs are half-height versions of their respective blocks.
description.minecraft.oak_stairs: Stairs are blocks that allow mobs and players to change elevation without jumping.
description.minecraft.oak_trapdoor: A trapdoor is a solid, transparent block that can be used as an openable 1×1 barrier.
description.minecraft.oak_wood: Wood or hyphae is a block that has the log's "bark" texture on all six sides.
description.minecraft.observer: An observer is a block that emits a redstone signal when the block or fluid it faces experiences a change.
description.minecraft.obsidian: Obsidian is a block found in all dimensions or created when water flows over a lava source.
description.minecraft.ocelot_spawn_egg: A spawn egg is an item used to spawn mobs directly.
description.minecraft.ochre_froglight: A froglight is a light-emitting block that is obtained when a frog eats a tiny magma cube. It comes in three variants based on the variant of frog that eats the magma cube.
description.minecraft.orange_banner: Banners are tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes and banner patterns.
description.minecraft.orange_bed: A bed is a block that allows a player to sleep and to reset their spawn point to within a few blocks of the bed in the Overworld. If the bed is obstructed or removed, the player spawns at the default world spawning location.
description.minecraft.orange_candle: A candle is a block that comes in any of the sixteen dye colors, as well as an undyed variant.
description.minecraft.orange_carpet: Carpets are thin variants of wool that can be dyed in any of the 16 colors.
description.minecraft.orange_concrete: Concrete is a solid block available in the 16 regular dye colors
description.minecraft.orange_concrete_po: Concrete powder is a gravity-affected block that is converted to concrete when touching water or lava. It comes in the 16 regular dye colors.
description.minecraft.orange_dye: Orange dye is a quasi-primary dye crafted from orange tulips, or by combining one red dye with one yellow dye.
description.minecraft.orange_glazed_terr: Glazed terracotta is a vibrant solid block that comes in the 16 regular dye colors, obtained by smelting colored terracotta.
description.minecraft.orange_shulker_box: A shulker box is a block that can store and transport items.
description.minecraft.orange_stained_gla: Glass is a decorative and fully transparent solid block that can be dyed into stained glass, or crafted into tinted glass.
A glass pane is a transparent block that can be used as a more efficient alternative to glass blocks.
description.minecraft.orange_terracotta: Terracotta is a block that comes in the sixteen dye colors (except with a brownish tint), as well as an undyed variant.
description.minecraft.orange_tulip: Flowers are non-solid plants that occur in a variety of shapes and colors.
description.minecraft.orange_wool: Wool is a block obtained from sheep that can be dyed in any of the sixteen different colors. It can be used as a crafting material and to block vibrations.

description.minecraft.oxidized_cut_coppe: The block of copper and cut copper are blocks that oxidize over time, gaining a verdigris appearance over four stages. They can be prevented from oxidising by being waxed with honeycombs. Non-cut, non-oxidised, non-waxed copper blocks are storage blocks equivalent to nine copper ingots.

description.minecraft.spawner: A monster spawner is a cage-like block that can spawn mobs, the type of which being visible within it as a miniature spinning version.
description.minecraft.spectral_arrow: An arrow serves as ammunition for bows, crossbows, and dispensers.
description.minecraft.spider_eye: A spider eye is a poisonous food and brewing item.
description.minecraft.spider_spawn_egg: A spawn egg is an item used to spawn mobs directly.
description.minecraft.splash_potion: Splash potions are a variant of potions that can be thrown.
description.minecraft.sponge: A sponge is a block that can be used to remove water around itself when placed, turning into a wet sponge in the process.
description.minecraft.spore_blossom: A spore blossom is a ceiling-hanging decorative block that emits green particles.
description.minecraft.spruce_boat: A boat is a drivable vehicle entity used primarily for fast transport of players and passenger mobs over bodies of water.
description.minecraft.spruce_button: A button is a non-solid block that can provide temporary redstone power.
description.minecraft.spruce_chest_boat: A boat with chest is a single chest occupying the passenger seat of a boat, and functions as such. As it can still be driven it can be used to transport items over bodies of water.
description.minecraft.spruce_door: A door is a block that can be used as a barrier that can be opened by hand or with redstone.
description.minecraft.spruce_fence: A fence is a barrier block that cannot normally be jumped over, similar to a wall. Unlike a wall, a player (but not mobs) can see through the openings in a fence.
description.minecraft.spruce_fence_gate: A fence gate is a block that shares the functions of both the door and the fence.
description.minecraft.spruce_hanging_sig:
A sign is a non-solid block that can display text. A sign can also be used to block or redirect the flow of water or lava while still allowing entities to pass.

A hanging sign can also display text, but it has more variable ways to be placed: on the side of and the underside of solid blocks, fences, walls, chains, and other hanging signs.
description.minecraft.spruce_leaves: Leaves are natural blocks that generate as part of trees.
description.minecraft.spruce_log: A log or stem is a naturally occurring block found in trees or huge fungi, primarily used as a building block, and to create planks, a versatile crafting ingredient.
description.minecraft.spruce_planks: Planks are common blocks used as building blocks and in crafting recipes.
description.minecraft.spruce_pressure_pl: A pressure plate is a non-solid block that can be used to detect players, mobs, items, etc.
description.minecraft.spruce_sapling: A sapling is a non-solid block that can be grown into a tree.
description.minecraft.spruce_sign: A sign is a non-solid block that can display text. A sign can also be used to block or redirect the flow of water or lava while still allowing entities to pass.
description.minecraft.spruce_slab: Slabs are half-height versions of their respective blocks.
description.minecraft.spruce_stairs: Stairs are blocks that allow mobs and players to change elevation without jumping.
description.minecraft.spruce_trapdoor: A trapdoor is a solid, transparent block that can be used as an openable 1×1 barrier.
description.minecraft.spruce_wood: Wood or hyphae is a block that has the log's "bark" texture on all six sides.
description.minecraft.spyglass: A spyglass is a tool used to zoom in on distant objects.
description.minecraft.squid_spawn_egg: A spawn egg is an item used to spawn mobs directly.
description.minecraft.stick: A stick is an item used for crafting many tools and items.
description.minecraft.sticky_piston: A piston is a block capable of pushing blocks, players, and mobs when given a redstone pulse.
description.minecraft.stone: Stone is a block found underground in the Overworld or on the surface of mountains.
description.minecraft.stone_axe: An axe is a tool mainly used to hasten the breaking of wood-based blocks, remove the surface layer of certain blocks, and as a melee weapon.
description.minecraft.stone_brick_slab: Slabs are half-height versions of their respective blocks.
description.minecraft.stone_brick_stairs: Stairs are blocks that allow mobs and players to change elevation without jumping.
description.minecraft.stone_brick_wall: A wall is a decorative block.
description.minecraft.stone_bricks: Stone bricks and the variants cracked stone bricks, mossy stone bricks, and chiseled stone bricks are materials found in structures such as strongholds, igloo basements, jungle temples, ocean ruins and ruined portals.
description.minecraft.stone_button: A button is a non-solid block that can provide temporary redstone power.
description.minecraft.stone_hoe: A hoe is a tool used to till dirt, grass blocks, and dirt paths into farmland, convert coarse dirt into dirt, as well as to harvest certain plant-based blocks quickly.
description.minecraft.stone_pickaxe: A pickaxe is one of the most commonly used tools in the game, being required to mine all ores, rock, rock-based blocks and metal-based blocks.
description.minecraft.stone_pressure_pla: A pressure plate is a non-solid block that can be used to detect players, mobs, items, etc.
description.minecraft.stone_shovel: Shovels are tools used to ease the process of collecting dirt, sand and other blocks with silk touch mining the complete block.
description.minecraft.stone_slab: Slabs are half-height versions of their respective blocks.
description.minecraft.stone_stairs: Stairs are blocks that allow mobs and players to change elevation without jumping.
description.minecraft.stone_sword: The sword is a melee weapon that is mainly used to deal damage to entities or for breaking certain blocks faster than by hand.
description.minecraft.stonecutter: The stonecutter is used to craft stone and copper related blocks in smaller and more precise quantities than crafting, and is more efficient than crafting for certain recipes.
description.minecraft.stray_spawn_egg: A spawn egg is an item used to spawn mobs directly.
description.minecraft.strider_spawn_egg: A spawn egg is an item used to spawn mobs directly.
description.minecraft.string: String is an item used in crafting recipes such as bows, fishing rods and leads.

description.minecraft.structure_block: A structure block is used to generate structures manually.
description.minecraft.structure_void: A structure void is an invisible block that allows existing blocks to remain unchanged rather than be overridden when using the structure block to load a structure.
description.minecraft.sugar: Sugar is a food ingredient and brewing ingredient made from sugar canes.
description.minecraft.sugar_cane: Sugar cane is a block found as 1–4-block-tall plants near water in the Overworld.
description.minecraft.sunflower: Flowers are non-solid plants that occur in a variety of shapes and colors.
description.minecraft.suspicious_stew: Suspicious stew is a food item that can give the player a status effect that depends on the flower used to craft it.
description.minecraft.sweet_berries: Sweet berries are a food item that are collected from sweet berry bushes.
description.minecraft.tadpole_bucket: A bucket of aquatic mob is a form of a water bucket with an aquatic mob (a fish, axolotl, or tadpole) inside.
description.minecraft.tadpole_spawn_egg: A spawn egg is an item used to spawn mobs directly.
description.minecraft.tall_grass: Grass is a non-solid plant block that has wheat seeds as a drop.
description.minecraft.target: A target is a block that provides a temporary redstone charge when hit by a projectile.
description.minecraft.terracotta: Terracotta is a block that comes in the sixteen dye colors (except with a brownish tint), as well as an undyed variant.
description.minecraft.tinted_glass: Tinted glass is a block that blocks light while being visually transparent.
description.minecraft.tipped_arrow: An arrow serves as ammunition for bows, crossbows, and dispensers.
description.minecraft.tnt: TNT is a block that can be primed by a redstone signal, flint and steel, stray fire or flaming projectile to generate an explosion.
description.minecraft.torch: Torches are non-solid blocks that emit light.
description.minecraft.totem_of_undying: A totem of undying is an uncommon combat item that can save holders from death.
description.minecraft.trader_llama_spawn: A spawn egg is an item used to spawn mobs directly.
description.minecraft.trapped_chest: A trapped chest functions as a normal chest for item storage, but it produces redstone power when opened.
description.minecraft.trident: A trident is a weapon used in both melee and ranged combat and is a rare drop from drowned.
description.minecraft.tripwire_hook: A tripwire hook is a block that can be used to detect entities (players, mobs, items, etc.
description.minecraft.tropical_fish: Tropical Fish are common passive mobs found in oceans, mangrove swamps and lush caves.
description.minecraft.tropical_fish_spaw: A spawn egg is an item used to spawn mobs directly.
description.minecraft.tube_coral: Coral is a type of non-solid block that comes in five variants: tube, brain, bubble, fire, and horn.
description.minecraft.tube_coral_block: A coral block is a solid block that comes in five variants: tube, brain, bubble, fire, and horn.
description.minecraft.tube_coral_fan: Coral fans are non-solid blocks that come in 5 variants: tube, brain, bubble, fire, and horn.
description.minecraft.tuff: Tuff is an ornamental rock formed from volcanic ash, occurring in underground blobs below Y=16.
description.minecraft.turtle_egg: A turtle egg (in Java Edition) or sea turtle egg (in Bedrock Edition) is a block containing 1–4 eggs that each hatch into a baby turtle.
description.minecraft.turtle_helmet: Helmets are a type of armor that covers the head of the player.
description.minecraft.turtle_spawn_egg: A spawn egg is an item used to spawn mobs directly.
description.minecraft.twisting_vines: Twisting vines are climbable upward-growing vegetation blocks found in the Nether in warped forests.
description.minecraft.verdant_froglight: A froglight is a light-emitting block that is obtained when a frog eats a tiny magma cube. It comes in three variants based on the variant of frog that eats the magma cube.
description.minecraft.vex_spawn_egg: A spawn egg is an item used to spawn mobs directly.
description.minecraft.villager_spawn_egg: A spawn egg is an item used to spawn mobs directly.
description.minecraft.vindicator_spawn_e: A spawn egg is an item used to spawn mobs directly.
description.minecraft.vine: Vines are climbable non-solid vegetation blocks that grow on walls.
description.minecraft.wandering_trader_s: A spawn egg is an item used to spawn mobs directly.

description.minecraft.warped_fungus: A fungus is a mushroom-like block that generates in the Nether.
description.minecraft.warped_fungus_on_a: A warped fungus on a stick is an item that can be used to control saddled striders.

description.minecraft.warped_nylium: Nylium is a variant of netherrack that generates in the Nether.
description.minecraft.warped_planks: Planks are common blocks used as building blocks and in crafting recipes.
description.minecraft.warped_roots: Roots are a non-solid "plant" block that come in two variants, crimson roots and warped roots, which generate naturally on warped or crimson nylium and soul soil in their respective biomes.

description.minecraft.warped_stem: A log or stem is a naturally occurring block found in trees or huge fungi, primarily used as a building block, and to create planks, a versatile crafting ingredient.
description.minecraft.warped_wart_block: Nether wart blocks are decorative blocks found in crimson forests and crafted using nether wart.
description.minecraft.water_bucket: A water bucket is a bucket filled with water.

description.minecraft.wheat: Wheat is an item primarily obtained by harvesting fully-grown wheat crops.
description.minecraft.wheat_seeds: Wheat seeds (in Java Edition) or seeds (in Bedrock Edition) are items obtained by breaking grass, or more abundantly harvested from wheat crops, and are used to plant them.
description.minecraft.white_banner: Banners are tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes and banner patterns.
description.minecraft.white_bed: A bed is a block that allows a player to sleep and to reset their spawn point to within a few blocks of the bed in the Overworld. If the bed is obstructed or removed, the player spawns at the default world spawning location.
description.minecraft.white_candle: A candle is a block that comes in any of the sixteen dye colors, as well as an undyed variant.

description.minecraft.white_concrete: Concrete is a solid block available in the 16 regular dye colors

description.minecraft.white_glazed_terra: Glazed terracotta is a vibrant solid block that comes in the 16 regular dye colors, obtained by smelting colored terracotta.
